claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination can create an interferon-rich inflammatory state that sensitizes tumors to immune checkpoint blockade

evidence.quote: Intratumoral delivery of an mRNA vaccine can create an interferon-rich inflammatory state that improves sensitivity to anti-PD-L1 therapy
Type I interferon response score (normalized units) 3.1 vs 1.0 - Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors, and some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination triggers broader antigen presentation on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome 62.3% vs 37.3% - Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome 40.6% vs 20.6% - Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape
Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase

claims.caveat: Immunopeptidomics readouts may vary across different tumor types and model systems

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival in patients receiving immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value p=0.01 - Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment
The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized with varied vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation and tumor-type mix heterogeneity, limiting causal interpretation

claims.claim: PD-L1 pathway activity increases following mRNA vaccination, creating rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade

evidence.quote: PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue 2.4x vs 1.0x - Checkpoint axis became more targetable
PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade

claims.caveat: PD-L1 induction was measured in specific model systems and may not be uniform across all tumor types

claims.claim: The mRNA component specifically is required for sensitization, as lipid particles alone do not produce the effect

evidence.quote: Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect
Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling

claims.caveat: Specific lipid particle formulations may vary in their immunogenicity independent of mRNA content
